column5: Started at 6am from Port D. ...we were the third boat out...drove straight to between Weller and the Bar...started in 60 fow...first line in about 6:30am....and before setting the third rod we already had 2 lakers at the boat.....one 21 Lbs and one about half that....lakers were not the target fish for the day though so we quickly moved away and deeper...as soon as we found the bait balls the action started and kept fairly steady throughout the morning...best results were in 140-150 fow 100-125 feet down.....anything bellow 40 feet was a King and all were solid sizes ....and anything above 40 feet was a Coho....no more lakers were caught..... Best lures were the NK Mag size in the following order......Blue/White /Silver (this got us 75% of the fish)....Watermelon ....Monkey Puke....7-8 fish came on the green, the blue and the white fly/flasher combos, those were run off the wire and raid dipsys in the top 40 feet of the column.... Not a bite on the leadcore all day even though we've tried anything from 2 to all 10 colors....  One King came on the Perch color Lyman down 100 feet.... Best speeds were 1.4-1.6 mps at the ball.... Most Kings were in the high teens (17-18 lbs) and the Cohos in the 4-7 lbs perfect BBQ size.... Had number of double headers....there were 4-5 boats in our area....5-6 more close to Wellar in shallow water....  Total for the day was 20/24 ......12 Chinook, 6 Coho and 2 Lake Trout  ....Both my guests were quite happy with the action as I let them reel and net most of the fish....I was the main driver for the day (my favorite position with buddies on board;-) All in all a great day out there...water was a bit bumpy in the morning  but a glass surface on the return ... Bellow are few shots from the day...         This is what one of the Kings had in its stomach. Well fed I'd say:      Cheers, Ice Fisherman
GREAT report........GREAT PICS.........  Thanks for sharing,  Bob
awesome, thanks for sharing, that laker is a beast.
awwwsome report!!!...thanks for sharing!!!
You were on them. Nice fish.  Great day had by all.

Nice fish!!!   That laker is a giant!
nice!  i fished 60fow and shallower today and didn't get a single nibble. i guess i'll be hitting some deeper water next run...  the speed of the ball is in meters per second?
Giant Laker! Nice!   LTF
sorry it is in miles/hr  Cheers, Ice Fisherman
nice going Emile. I still have to find the groove out there this year. Last 3 outings have been a bust. Good to see someone get on them
Thanks for the great report!  What was the water temp where you caught the lakers?
47 degrees on the surface, and 42 down 120 feet  Cheers, Ice Fisherman
Thanks for sharing! Sounds like a very good day on the water
nice haul...  are those alewives?
hey, thanks alot for the detailed report!  Lyman and Mags, good stuff buddy!  May just skip over the Standard Warriors and go with the Mags. right off the bat this year.
Yes Mike they are. And the biggest one was huge...  Cheers, Ice Fisherman
Monster laker! Great report. THX.
Good shooting Emil. Wish I had the time to get out there.
Way to go!  I went out also for a few hours, but only got this little guy.  Was off Toronto Island.     Uploaded with ImageShack.us
awesome fishing report emil !!! what a tanker of a laker  ....cheers
